channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Brougham Road and Trederwen Road E8, 14th July
item.description:
The two roads above are cleaned very rarely and there is always refuse in the gutter and on the pavement. We need these streets to be cleaned every week and the Community Centre in Brougham Road needs a new solution. It is a disgrace. This is an old probl

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brougham Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Bike unlocked and left against Park railings in Gore Road, 14th July
item.description:
The bike has been here a few days and has moved along a bit from original starting point. It is currently opposite no. 40 Gore Road. Someone has now taken the saddle and mudguards.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gore Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Resident scene fly tips a large trolley full of household items.also fly tipped the trolley after he finished in the public bins at Mallard close E9 5JL block of flats on 18/05/25 at 19:09pm. Resident walking with the shopping trolley from his home address in the Daintry Way E9 5JJ area all the way down Osborne Road to Mallard close block bins to fly tip. Resident Regularly fly tips around the whole Trowbridge estate. Is unfair on residence to have to put up with this anti-social behavior. Someone from Hackney Council could please look into this and investigate to put a stop to this fly tipping behavior. His behaviour is not fair on the residents,hackney Council cleaning teams. Hackney Council have to pay the cleanup cost due to this residence behavior., 14th July
item.description:
Antisocial behaviour fly tipping. Tenant scene fly tipping 03 Daintry way E9 5JJ. Regular offender authority action.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mallard Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hazelmere road square, 14th July
item.description:
I saw a road sweeper on Friday morning he swept up a couple of bits of paper and then moved on leaving the litter that in the photos, this is a continuous problem I don't know why but your road sweepers seem to refuse to sweep this Square, there are 4 houses on this Square and we are continuously having to sweep our doorsteps because of the rubbish being blown onto our doorsteps we don't we're only asking that road is swept once a week like everybody else's even though I do think because of the continuous rubbish that is dropped in the Square we do need a road sweeper more than once a week but we would just like a road sweeper that does their jobs properly please.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glengall Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, 14th July
item.description:
This has been happened often they empty the containers and they leave the rubbish on the floor and I do have a lot of reference numbers as well Here is your case reference number CAS-1358580-Z8F4M9 Here is your waste issue report case reference number CAS-1393777-P1S5C3 Here is your waste issue report case reference number CAS-1407867-L8G7P8 Hope we can sort out this problem because it’s really helpful and safe. It’s snow something nice to leave around or alternative will be the best thing to set up a Camera in this area. Kind Regards

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 374, Harrow Road, Maida Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: The Pub owner Duke Of Welllington claims as theirs public space and kicks children away, 14th July
item.description:
Our 2 years old son and us were playing at the Haggerston Street School War Memorial area/park. The pub owner came to me and said we should leave because we disturb the drinking beer customers. But this is public space and the pub shouldn't serve there.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Haggerston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
